body.p:
London Ky.
May 17 1862
His Excellency Gov Magoffin
Sir

enclose you the Petition of John Smith and that of John Ellison I believe the statements in each petition are true. I know that the party for whom John Smith was bail was not indicted -- I would further state that this county is pretty well destroyed, what the Southern army left last fall, the Federal Army has pretty well consumed, and I tell you that the people cannot bear the burdens they put upon them and pay fines & forfeitures -- I think your Excellency would do a good work to remit both the forfeitures.

I am Respectfully &c
W. H. Randall
